name: Capo Project
summary: Learn about .CAPOBUNDLE files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: Capo is an app that guitarists and other musicians use to learn how to play songs. The program allows musicians to import a song saved as an MP3 or other audio file and then either automatically or manually determine what chords or notes the song includes. Musicians can then play along with the song (slowing the song if needed), using the chords and notes they've marked down.

The notation projects Capo users create are saved as CAPOBUNDLE files. Both the macOS and iOS versions of Capo save users' projects as CAPOBUNDLE files. MacOS users can save their CAPOBUNDLE files anywhere on their Mac, while iOS users must save their CAPOBUNDLE files to their iCloud Drive.
The free version of Capo does not save changes users make to CAPOBUNDLE files. It also does not allow users to export the audio a CAPOBUNDLE file contains.

description: A CAPOBUNDLE file is a project file created by Capo, a music notation app available for macOS and iOS. It is a macOS package that contains an .MP3 file, .JSON files, and .DAT files. When opened in Capo, CAPOBUNDLE files show their included MP3 file's waveform, as well as guitar chords or notes that correspond to points in the waveform.

instructions: You can open a CAPOBUNDLE file in Capo (Mac, iOS). To open a CAPOBUNDLE file in the macOS version of Capo, open Capo and select File → Open... from the program's menu bar. Then, navigate to and open your CAPOBUNDLE file.

To open a CAPOBUNDLE file in the iOS version of Capo, place the file in the Capo folder in your iCloud Drive. Then, open Capo and select Browse → iCloud Drive → Capo. From there, select and open your CAPOBUNDLE file.
